text.name: desc_poppy
text.text: Poppy Seeds is a Fruit, mostly used in making Bread.

text.name: ui_vehicleReset
text.text: The vehicle / device has been reset to the dealer.

text.name: function_pigFeeder
text.text: Maize 50%+ Root Crops 25%+ Oilseed 20%+ Grain 5% = Pigfeed Production

text.name: function_multiTank
text.text: This tank trailer can be used to transport all types of liquids. Vehicles, equipment and storages can be filled.

text.name: function_multiPalletPacker
text.text: With this machine, potatoes, sugar beets, onions or carrots are packed in pallets for sale or loaded onto conveyor belts.

text.name: function_multiWrapper
text.text: The bale wrapper wraps the bales of all grasses in foil so that they can ferment into silage.

text.name: function_multiBaler
text.text: This baler presses straw as well as all grasses and their hay into bales.

text.name: function_multiStacker
text.text: This bale collector loads all types of round bales and facilitates their transportation.

text.name: function_haulmTopperCarrot
text.text: This haulm topper removes the haulm before carrots can be harvested.

text.name: function_haulmTopperOnion
text.text: This haulm topper removes the haulm before onions can be harvested.

text.name: function_harvestingCarrotWithoutPreparer
text.text: This harvester digs the carrots out of the ground. This machine can only be used after the haulm has been cut.

text.name: function_harvestingOnionWithoutPreparer
text.text: This harvester digs the onions out of the ground. This machine can only be used after the haulm has been cut.

text.name: function_mowerConditioner
text.text: This mower has also installed a conditioner. This means that the mown is immediately dried.

text.name: snow01
text.text: The BGA is filled with snow. Our clients can't safely get to the silage or the sellpoint. Please clear out the whole lot.

text.name: snow02
text.text: The Fire trucks can't get out. Snow is blocking the Fire department. Please clear out the whole lot.

text.name: snow03
text.text: People can't get to the Gardencenter. The parking lot is filled with snow. Please clear out the snow for us.

text.name: snow04
text.text: Customers can't reach Lime station. Please clear out the snow.

text.name: snow05
text.text: The yard at my sheep farm is filled with snow. I can't get to my animals. Please clear out the snow for me.

text.name: snow06
text.text: Cars are getting stuck in the snow at the Horse stable. Can you clear the roads for snow?

text.name: snow07
text.text: The road to the Water mill is blocked with snow. Can you please clear it?

text.name: snow08
text.text: Deleveries can't make it to the Camping site because of snow. Please clear a path.

text.name: snow09
text.text: I can't get to my cows. Can you please clear a path to the Cow stable?

text.name: snow10
text.text: I can't get to my pigs. Can you please clear a path to the Pig stable?

text.name: snow11
text.text: The roads at the Compost plant is slippery due to snow. Can you please clear them out?

text.name: snow12
text.text: The parkinglot at the supermarket is filled with snow. Please clear it.

text.name: snow13
text.text: The milktruck can't unload milk due to snow. Please clear the lot.

text.name: snow14
text.text: Customers can't get to the Butcher. Please clear out the snow.

text.name: snow15
text.text: Livestock trailers are getting stuck in the snow at the Animal dealer. Please clear out the roads.

text.name: snow16
text.text: It's almost impossible for customers to refuel. Please clear the lot for snow.

text.name: snow17
text.text: The Vehicle shop parking lot is filled with snow. Please clear it.

text.name: snow18
text.text: The DIY market is covered in snow. Please clear the lot.

text.name: helpCategory_Eiersholt_workshop
text.text: Workshop and fuelstation at the mainfarm

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_0
text.text: The player should be familiar with the basic functions of the game, as the standard basic help screen is not shown here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_1
text.text: This map is completely playable without any mods.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_2
text.text: However, in order to enjoy all functions to the fullest, some mods are required.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_3
text.text: Many players will already know most of the recommended mods, as they add a lot of realism to Farming Simulator 19.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_4
text.text: Which these mods are is briefly explained in the chapter 'Recommended Mods'. How they work in detail is not discussed further here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f1
text.text: But first of all some information about the main farm.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f2
text.text: In New farmer mode you already have various vehicles, storage facilities and silos available from the start of the game.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f3
text.text: The silos are already filled with a small amount of Fruit, Fertilizer, Seeds and Lime to make the start a little easier.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f4
text.text: The Fertilizer, Seeds and Lime silos will have to be refilled manually. To fill the silos the flaps must be opened.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f5
text.text: You own enough equipment and land to get you started, but it is recommended to upgrade to more effecient equipment so you can continue to grow the farm.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_f6
text.text: There is a tank in the yard that is kindly filled automatically by the Raiffeisen market. Here you can buy liquid fertilizers and herbicides directly.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_5
text.text: The map contains some adapted mods, especially for the extensions by MaizePlus but they are also needed for the additional fruits.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_8
text.text: - Grimme KS75 - A haulm topper available for both carrots and onions.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_9
text.text: - Grimme SE260 - A harvester, also available for both carrots and onions.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_10
text.text: - Grimme RH2460 - A palletizer for carrots, onions, potatoes and sugar beets.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_11
text.text: - Holmer TerraDos T4 40 - harvester for carrots, onions, potatoes and sugar beets.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_12
text.text: - Holmer HR12 - An attachment for the TerraDos, for carrots and also for onions available.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_13
text.text: - Kuhn FBP3135 - A baling / wrapping combination for all grass and straw with additional foil colors.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_14
text.text: - Kuhn SW4014 - A bale wrapper for wrapping all bales with additional foil colors.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_15
text.text: - NH Discbine313, Pöttinger NovaCat301 and X8 and Krone BigM450 - mowers with additional conditioner.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_16
text.text: These allow you to skip a drying stage directly while mowing.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_17
text.text: - Ursus T127 - An additional bale collector.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_18
text.text: - Ursus Z586 - Another bale wrapper, also with additional foil colors.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_19
text.text: - Lizard MKS8 and MKS32 - These tankers can transport all liquids. Vehicles, equipment and storages can be filled.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_20
text.text: Various colors can also be configured.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_21
text.text: In addition to all standard fruits, the following fruits are available:

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_23
text.text: - Grains: Rye, Millet, Spelt and Triticale

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_26
text.text: Alfalfa - When cut it will produce Alfalfa fresh which can be baled into alfalfa bales. These bales can be wrapped and turned into Silage. Alfalfa fresh can also be tedded and turned into Alfalfa hay.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_27
text.text: Clover - Fresh cut clover can be baled into clover bales, or baled and wrapped and turned into Silage, or it can be tedded and turned into Clover hay.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_28
text.text: Field grass - This is a tall grass that can be cut and turned into normal grass and hay, or can be harvested during the second year of growth using a combine harvester (using Seasons and M+ HE). Doing so will get you Fieldgrass seeds which can be sold. You will also get Horsegrass semi-dry which can be baled and wrapped to make Horsesilage.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_29
text.text: Pasture grass - It works like normal grass. It can be mowed, turned into hay or fermented into silage in the bunker silo.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_30
text.text: Horse grass - Horsegrass can be cut and turned into Horse hay. Horsegrass can also be turned into silage in the bunker silo. Wrapping a bale of Horsegrass semi-dry (tedded twice) will give you Horse silage.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_31
text.text: Miscanthus - Miscanthus can be cut using a forage harvester.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_32
text.text: Compost can be used for fertilization.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_33
text.text: Garden center - In addition to Grain, Wool, Eggs, etc. Slurry can also be sold here, as well as Fertilizer, Herbicide and Seeds can be bought.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_34
text.text: Dairy - In addition to Milk, of course, Spelt, Soybeans and Oats can also be delivered here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_35
text.text: Campsite - In the search for consistently high-quality products, campers always buy Milk, Eggs, Potatoes, Carrots and Onions.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_36
text.text: Grain Mill - All types of grain can be sold here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_37
text.text: Watermill - As with the grain mill, all types of grain are accepted here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_38
text.text: Brewery - Wheat, Barley, Spelt, Oats and even Sugar cane are fermented here to make something drinkable.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_39
text.text: Fodder shop - In addition to various silages, almost everything that is needed for feed production is traded here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_40
text.text: Also in bale form, of course.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_41
text.text: TOOM - In addition to Wool and Wood chips, the DIY market also buys Miscanthus and Field grass.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_42
text.text: Raiffeisen - At this sell point, you can really sell anything the map can offer. Also as a bale.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_43
text.text: Fertilizer, Herbicide and Seeds can also be purchased here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_44
text.text: McCain - In addition to Potatoes, Onions can be sold here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_45
text.text: South Sugar - In addition to Sugar beets, Sugar cane can be sold here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_46
text.text: Sawmill - Of course, tree trunks are accepted here. But also Miscanthus and Wood chips.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_47
text.text: The latter can also be bought here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_48
text.text: Composting plant - In addition to buying Compost, it is also possible to sell this again besides various other fruits.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_49
text.text: BGA - Of course, chopped material and grass can be fermented into silage here, which can then be profitably filled into the BGA.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_50
text.text: Any digestate can of course also be loaded.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_51
text.text: Heating plant - heating power from biomass, so Straw, Wood chips and Miscanthus can be sold here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_52
text.text: Lime station - As the name suggests, Lime can be purchased here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_53
text.text: Supermarket - The supermarket buys all Root crops, Eggs, Milk as well as Sheep wool and Cotton.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_54
text.text: Animal dealer - As the name suggests, animals can be bought here and brought to the stables yourself. Of course, the dealer also buys animals.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_55
text.text: The Chicken coop is owned by the player from the start of the game when playing in New Farmer mode.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_56
text.text: Nothing has changed in terms of the actual function.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_57
text.text: However, at the tipping area, which needs to be cleaned from time to time, Wheat, Triticale, Rye,

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_58
text.text: Soybeans, Corn, Barley and Millet as well as Sugar beets and Carrots can be delivered.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_59
text.text: Even though the cowshed is located at the main farmyard, it is not in the player's possession at the start of the game.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_60
text.text: In order to be able to use it and a few associated buildings, the area must first be purchased. Doors will not open if you don't own the area the building is located on.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_61
text.text: A feed mixing plant also belongs to the cow area.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_62
text.text: If you put Straw (20%), Silage (30%) and Hay (50%) into the feed mixer, you get TMR.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_63
text.text: Straw, as well as Grass, Hay and Silage can also be fed to the cows as bales.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_64
text.text: Of course, the cows also litter the barn a little, so it should be mucked out from time to time.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_65
text.text: The pigsty is not owned by the player at the beginning of the game.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_66
text.text: Once you have acquired it, you are able to open the doors and use the pigstable. You also have access to the neighboring hall, in which e.g. fruits can be stored.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_67
text.text: A feed mixing plant that produces pig feed is also acquired here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_68
text.text: To get pig feed you need to fill it with Maize (50%), Wheat, Barley, Triticale or Rye (25%), Soybeans, Rape or Sunflower (20%)

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_69
text.text: as well as Potatoes, Sugar beets or Carrots (5%)

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_70
text.text: In the pigs stable straw or straw bales can be used directly for bedding.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_71
text.text: The pigsty needs to be cleaned out every now and then.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_72
text.text: In order to be able to breed and keep horses, the area with the Horse paddock must be purchased.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_73
text.text: In addition to Oats, horses need Grass or Horse silage as well as Hay and Carrots.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_74
text.text: Grass, Straw, Hay and Silage can also be fed as bales.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_75
text.text: If the horses are adequately cared for, they produce manure. The stable itself does not have to be mucked out.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_76
text.text: Our hard-working helpers take care of that, so to speak.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_77
text.text: The sheep farm has to be bought, should you decide to start wool production.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_78
text.text: The sheep do not produce manure, nor do they have to be mucked out. Only the feeding area should be kept clean.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_79
text.text: This is where Silage, Hay, Grass, Sugar beets and Carrots can be tipped or deposited in bales.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_80
text.text: If the animals are adequately cared for, nothing stands in the way of wool production.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_81
text.text: With the exception of cotton wool, all fruit can be stored in the Center Depot.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_82
text.text: In the centrally located round roof halls Wood chips, Sugar beets and Potatoes can be stored.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_83
text.text: Sugarcane, Carrots and Onions can be stored on the front of the building opposite of the round roof halls.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_84
text.text: The barn next to it accepts Straw and all kinds of Grass and Hay.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_85
text.text: Wheat, Barley, Oats and Rye can be stored in the large buildings that follows.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_86
text.text: In the building complex on the left side of the entrance area, Rape, Maize, Sunflowers,

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_87
text.text: Soybeans, Millet, Triticale and Field grass can be stored.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_88
text.text: Last but not least, there is a Manure storage area in the upper left corner, where Compost can also be stored.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_89
text.text: Since there is not enough space on the premises of the Center Depot, the Slurry storage facility had to be located externally.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_90
text.text: In addition to Liquid manure, Digestate can also be temporarily stored here.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_PS
text.text: The areas of the Center Depot and slurry storage facility cannot be purchased and are available to all players at any time.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_91
text.text: There is a small workshop with an attached fuel station on the premises of the main farmyard.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_92
text.text: This area must also be bought in order to be able to use it. The fuel station is excluded from this.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_93
text.text: However, you have to fill it yourself.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_94
text.text: MaizePlus is a global expansion that gives the player the opportunity to produce corn silage and grass silage as bales,

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_95
text.text: as well as using both silages in the driving silo and for feeding.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_96
text.text: In addition, you can also use the extension file (MaizePlus_ccmExtension) to produce raw CCM (corn flour) and CCM.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_97
text.text: The Forage Extension completely revises the feeding system in the FS. On the one hand, the division of the different silages

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_98
text.text: by MaisPlus is taken into account during feeding, on the other hand, the feeding system is also generally

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_99
text.text: being redesigned, so that it becomes a little more interesting and maybe more realistic.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_100
text.text: The Seasons Mod changes the basic way of playing the Farming Simulator, introducing the seasons and

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_101
text.text: all aspects of gameplay, such as weather, growth, economy, maintenance of vehicles and animals, will be adjusted accordingly.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_102
text.text: Expand your agricultural business with the pelletizing of straw materials and increase productivity with the

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_103
text.text: powerful machines from KRONE as well as from Bressel and Lade.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_104
text.text: This global script extends the standard animal pens and the supported modded pens by the following functions:

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_105
text.text: - Water add-on - For a small purchase fee, your local plumber will build a water pipe with which you can easily

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_106
text.text: ensure the water supply for your animals.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_107
text.text: - Milk Addon - Are you too busy to deliver your cow's milk to the dealer yourself? For a small fee, you can ask

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_108
text.text: a local contractor to do this for you at the best available rate. Let's just hope there aren't any

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_109
text.text: incidents preventing the sale from happening when they want it to.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_110
text.text: - Chicken Addon - After careful research, the local farmers have decided that they should be giving their chickens

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_111
text.text: water too, it's only fair. Your chicken pens now have a water trough.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_112
text.text: The manure system changes the whole gameplay experience in handling slurry. Find out what it means to pump slurry as a real farmer.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_113
text.text: Use the filling arms to pump from open containers such as field edge containers, slurry basins and water basins.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_114
text.text: Use a special filling arm to suck in from the docking station, or just use the suction hose.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_115
text.text: With the suction hose you can pump liquids from one container into the other and simply lengthen it,

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_116
text.text: to bridge longer distances. Compatible suction points are marked with the 'manure system symbol'.

text.name: helpText_Eiersholt_117
text.text: Pumping does not always happen at the same speed, as thick liquid manure or the distance also affect the pump performance.
